author: Zahra Hirji
description: The Environmental Protection Agency on Wednesday finalized a rule granting oil and gas operators more than a year in additional time to comply with mandates set by former President Joe Biden to replace leaky equipment and routinely monitor for escaped methane.
title: New EPA Rule Gives Oil, Gas Firms More Time to Fix Equipment Leaking Methane

author: Fabiano Maisonnave
description: The country’s environment minister said the “gravitational pull” of the US helped undermine a key proposal at the UN climate talks.
title: US Absence Hurt Fossil Fuel Exit Push at COP30, Says Brazil’s Silva

author: Nacha Cattan, Janet Lorin, Liam Knox
description: Northwestern University is closing in on a deal with President Donald Trump’s administration to pay roughly $75 million in order to restore about $790 million in frozen federal research grants, according to a person familiar with the negotiations.
title: Northwestern Nears Roughly $75 Million Deal With Trump

author: Gregory Korte
description: A wave of departures is making the midterm outlook even tougher.
title: House Retirements Are Raising a Warning for Republicans

author: Josh Wingrove
description: US President Donald Trump said that he would not invite South Africa to participate in next year’s G-20 summit in Miami and said he planned to “stop all payments and subsidies” to the country, as relations between Washington and Pretoria continue to deteriorate.
title: Trump Says He Won’t Invite South Africa to G-20 in Miami

author: Walter Brandimarte
description: Former President Martin Vizcarra became the latest Peruvian leader sentenced to jail after a local court found him guilty of corruption and ordered him to serve 14 years in prison.
title: Peru’s Vizcarra Joins Fellow Ex-Presidents Sentenced to Prison

author: Volodymyr Verbianyi, Jorgelina Do Rosario
description: The International Monetary Fund has announced an agreement with Ukraine on a new financing program, sending a positive signal to the war-torn nation’s international allies.
title: Ukraine Reaches $8.2 Billion IMF Deal Amid Funding Risks

author: Philip Aldrick, Alex Wickham, Ellen Milligan, Lucy White
description: Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves did enough in her budget to help her and Prime Minister Keir Starmer survive, building back a vital fiscal buffer and expanding welfare.
title: Reeves’ Budget Wins the Day, But Stores Up Future Problems

author: Emily Birnbaum
description: A US House committee is calling on Anthropic Chief Executive Officer Dario Amodei to testify about a Chinese cyber-espionage attack the company revealed earlier this month.
title: Anthropic Called to Testify in House on China-Backed Cyberattack

author: Anthony Capaccio
description: The Pentagon concluded that Alibaba Group Holding Ltd., Baidu Inc. and BYD Co. should be added to a list of companies that aid the Chinese military, according to a letter to Congress sent roughly three weeks before Donald Trump and Xi Jinping agreed to a broad trade truce.
title: Pentagon Cited Alibaba on China Military Aid in Oct. 7 Letter

author: Anthony Halpin
description: As President Vladimir Putin’s war on Ukraine enters a fourth winter, Russians are having to come to grips with its growing impact on nearly every aspect of their daily lives.
title: Russians Are Starting to Feel Real Economic Pain From Putin’s War

author: Greg Ritchie, Naomi Tajitsu, Alice Atkins
description: Vanguard Group Inc. and Royal London Asset Management Ltd. bought gilts on Wednesday as UK Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves’ budget largely won favor with markets, sparking the biggest rally in longer-dated bonds since April.
title: Vanguard, Royal London Buy Gilts as Budget Spurs Bond Rally

author: Tom Rees, Marion Dakers
description: Some 5.4 million workers will have been pushed into higher tax brackets of between 40% and 45% by the start of the next decade after Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves extended a policy of freezing income thresholds.
title: UK Stealth Tax Set to Push 5 Million More Into Bands Over 40%

author: Irina Anghel
description: UK Chancellor Rachel Reeves announced more than 80 policies at the budget on Nov. 26, including tax rises that allowed her to double a key fiscal buffer without breaking a manifesto pledge on income tax rates.
title: Here Are the Main Winners and Losers of the UK Budget

author: David Voreacos
description: A Georgia judge dismissed the last remaining criminal charges against President Donald Trump for allegedly interfering in the 2020 election, ending an ill-fated case that had led to the disqualification of the original prosecutor, Fulton County District Attorney Fani Willis.
title: Trump Election Interference Case in Georgia Dismissed by Judge

author: Greg Stohr
description: The US Supreme Court declined for now to let President Donald Trump’s administration oust the director of the US Copyright Office, deferring a decision in the legal fight until at least January.
title: Supreme Court Lets Copyright Office Head Stay in Job for Now

author: Gaspard Sebag
description: Authorities in France pressed spying charges and preventively jailed a woman who founded a pro-Russian association for reaching out to business executives for intelligence.
title: Pro-Russian Spy Suspect Jailed for Approaching French Executives

author: Alex Vasquez
description: India wants to boost trade with Mexico in software, pharmaceuticals and IT, its top Mexican diplomat said, while also hoping President Claudia Sheinbaum will exempt its exports from tariffs she’s proposed on a range of Asian goods.
title: India Eyes More Mexico Trade, Hopes to Avoid Sheinbaum Tariffs

author: Katie Linsell
description: Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves hit large retailers with higher taxes on their warehouses and biggest stores, as she tries to deliver on a promise to level the playing field for struggling smaller shops.
title: UK Hits Biggest Retailers to Ease Tax Burden on Struggling Shops

author: Zosia Wanat, Konrad Krasuski
description: Poland, the biggest beneficiary of the European Union’s military funding program, is aiming to spend a big chunk of the loans to build up its drone capabilities and defenses in the face of aerial incursions by Russia.
title: Poland to Bolster Drone Capabilities With New EU Defense Funding

author: Irina Vilcu, Andra Timu
description: Romania will set up a mechanism to place companies at risk of being hit by international sanctions under special oversight, such as the local unit of Russian state-owned Lukoil PJSC, a cabinet member said.
title: Romania Ready to Impose Oversight of Companies Hit by Sanctions

author: Nacha Cattan, Max Rivera
description: New York City’s next mayor will need to spend $1 billion to help owners of affordable housing units avoid defaulting amid surging costs — a predicament that will become even more dire if rents are frozen, according to the New York Housing Conference.
title: NYC’s Squeezed Landlords Need $1 Billion to Help Avoid Default

author: Erik Larson
description: President Donald Trump failed to sway a US appeals court to revive his civil lawsuit accusing Hillary Clinton and others of conspiring to tarnish his 2016 campaign with bogus claims of collusion with Russia.
title: Trump Loses Appeal to Revive Conspiracy Suit Against Clinton

author: Krishna Karra
description: For the full experience visit: GPS Interference Snarls Venezuela as US Warns of Hazardous Skies
title: GPS Interference Snarls Venezuela as US Warns of Hazardous Skies

description: BISSAU, Guinea-Bissau (AP) — Soldiers in Guinea-Bissau appeared on state television saying they have seized power in the country, following reports of gunshots near the presidential palace on Wednesday, three days after national elections were held.
title: Soldiers in Guinea-Bissau Say They Have Seized Power

author: Ellen Milligan
description: The UK will begin charging national insurance on salary-sacrificed pension contributions over £2,000 ($2,642) per year from 2029.
title: UK to Limit Tax-Free Pension Contributions From 2029

author: Jamie Nimmo
description: Britain’s electric and plug-in hybrid vehicle owners will be subject to a pay-per-mile tax, under UK budget measures tipped to dent demand at a time when carmakers must meet an EV sales mandate.
title: UK’s £1.4 Billion EV Mileage Tax Will Hit Demand, Watchdog Says

author: Tala Ahmadi, Rose Henderson
description: The UK has imposed tax rises on the UK’s online gambling sector, one of many budget measures described in an analysis released in error before Rachel Reeves was due to reveal the changes in the House of Commons.
title: UK’s Reeves Moves to Raise Taxes on Key Forms of Online Gambling

author: Eamon Farhat
description: The UK will wipe £2.3 billion ($3 billion) from energy bills on average for the next three years by cutting some green levies that consumers pay to support renewable electricity.
title: UK to Cut £2.3 Billion a Year From Energy Bills, OBR Says

author: Philip Aldrick
description: Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves expanded her key fiscal buffer to £22 billion ($29 billion) from £9.9 billion in March, the UK’s official budget watchdog said, in an analysis released ahead of her speech in error.
title: Reeves Secures Larger Fiscal Buffer in Budget Released Early

author: Caitlin Reilly
description: President Donald Trump decamped to his Mar-a-Lago resort in Florida late Tuesday for the Thanksgiving holiday with any effort to control spiking health care premiums — a key issue for Republicans whose economic appeal to voters has waned since last year’s election — still very much in flux.
title: Trump, GOP Head Into Thanksgiving Without Obamacare Premium Fix

author: Sanne Wass
description: Senior officials from the US, Denmark and Greenland are expected to meet in Nuuk in December to discuss military and civil cooperation, the first formal three-party talks since President Donald Trump stunned his allies by demanding ownership of Greenland.
title: US, Denmark, Greenland Officials to Resume Talks After Trump Bid

author: Milda Seputyte
description: Lithuania’s top envoy warned that a surge in cases of weather balloons ferrying smuggled goods from neighboring Belarus would harm Minsk’s ambitions to seek an accord with the US.
title: Lithuania Sees Hybrid Attacks Hurting US-Belarus Rapprochement

author: Daniel Basteiro
description: Spain should make the most of its robust economy by ramping up structural reforms and medium-term fiscal sustainability, according to the OECD.
title: Spain Must Use Resilience to Build Fiscal Buffers, OECD Says

author: Nectar Gan
description: The biggest flashpoint between Washington and Beijing has returned to center stage.
title: Taiwan Feels the Heat of US-China-Japan Tussle

author: Nduka Orjinmo
description: Two dozen students abducted from a school in Nigeria were freed after more than a week in captivity, but hundreds of others seized in separate incidents remain missing as the West African nation reels from a spate of mass kidnappings.
title: Nigerian Schoolgirls Freed Eight Days After Mass Kidnapping

author: Matthew Hill
description: Zambia’s presidency rejected proposed regulations that seek to give the state a minimum 15% stake in mines producing copper and other critical minerals without having to pay for it.
title: Zambian Presidency Shuns Plan to Give State Free Stake in Mines

author: Zoe Schneeweiss
description: Germany is in danger of underperforming on growth and faces a longer-term struggle to achieve meaningful expansion unless it pursues “bold” reforms, according to the International Monetary Fund.
title: Germany Risks Growth Undershoot Without Reforms, IMF Warns

author: Jorge Valero, Andrea Palasciano, Katharina Rosskopf
description: The European Union is prepared to put forward a legal text to finally enable the bloc to use Russia’s immobilized central bank assets to back a €140 billion ($162 billion) loan for Ukraine.
title: EU Prepares Legal Assurances to Unlock €140 Billion Ukraine Loan

author: Greg Sullivan
description: US presidential envoy Steve Witkoff will visit Russia next week along with other American officials, a Kremlin official said, as US President Donald Trump continues his latest push for a deal to end his Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin’s war in Ukraine.
title: Russia Says US Envoy Witkoff to Visit Moscow Next Week

author: Yoshiaki Nohara
description: Japanese Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi said she hadn’t intended to get into any details of a Taiwan contingency in recent remarks that have been fiercely criticized by China.
title: Japan’s Takaichi Says Didn’t Intend to Get Specific on Taiwan

author: Ditas B Lopez
description: The Philippines has frozen more assets allegedly linked to graft-ridden flood control projects, raising the total to around 12 billion pesos ($204 million), President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. said on Wednesday.
title: Philippines Freezes $204 Million Worth of Assets in Graft Probe

author: Cindy Wang, Yian Lee
description: Taiwan plans to spend an extra $40 billion on its defenses, President Lai Ching-te said in a commentary in the Washington Post, a long-telegraphed move he described as necessary to deter China from using force against the democracy.
title: Taiwan’s Lai Vows Extra $40 Billion for Defense Against China

author: Erica Yokoyama
description: Japanese Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi unveiled Japan’s largest round of extra spending since the easing of pandemic restrictions last week. Now she faces the question of how to fund it without adding to market nervousness.
title: Japan’s Takaichi Seeks to Fund Stimulus Without Spooking Markets

author: Dan Strumpf, Advait Palepu
description: As US-India relations began to sour earlier this year, drug-control experts briefed officials in the Trump administration on how the South Asian nation fit into the murky trade in chemicals used to make fentanyl.
title: Trump’s Fentanyl Fight Turns to India in ‘Game of Whack-a-Mole’

author: Justin Sink
description: US President Donald Trump said he urged Chinese President Xi Jinping to increase the speed and size of agricultural purchases and said Beijing had “more or less agreed” to do so.
title: Trump Says Xi ‘Pretty Much’ Agreed to Expand Agricultural Buys
